document_data.name: Ekene-Afa
document_data.text: Prince Ekene-Afa controls the weapon trade here in Port Nyanzaru, remember that.
document_data.mainbody:
Within Port Nyanzaru, Ekene-Afa had a monopoly on the sale of all non-[[magic]]al armaments and weapons<ref group="note">While Ekene-Afa sold shields, a different merchant Prince, [[Zhanthi]] controlled the sale of [[armor]]. Likewise, although she sold riding tack and wagons, [[Ifan Talro'a]], controlled the sale of [[mount]]s and [[beast]]s of burden. In weapons, she most often dealt in [[yklwa]]s, [[flint]] [[dagger]]s, and wood or [[reptile]]-hide [[shield]]s. She also sold a limited number of [[magic]] weapons, [[ammunition]], and shields in partnership with fellow merchant prince [[Wakanga O'tamu]], whom she paid for the [[Item enchantment|enchantments]].

She had the authority to issue commands to the garrison and [[ballista]] batteries at [[Fort Nyanzaru]].
document_data.Description: She was an accomplished warrior,{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|16}}
document_data.Personality: Ekene-Afa was a brave warrior and a tough negotiator. She demanded respect from those she met, and did not tolerate fools.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|24}} She did not mind endangering her allies if it meant a better chance for victory, but she was also a woman of her word.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|17}}
document_data.Possessions: Like other merchant princes, Ekene-Afa maintained a villa in Port Nyanzaru's [[Port Nyanzaru/Merchants' Ward|Merchants' Ward]], specifically on [[Throne Hill]].
document_data.Relationships:
Ekene-Afa was married to a noted artist, [[Kura (Chultan)|Kura]]. They had two sons, [[Soshen]] and [[Tiryk]], who were each named after a river in [[Chult]].

Her monopoly, like those of other merchant princes, was enforced with the help of the [[Ytepka Society]]. Any arms merchants or [[blacksmith]]s hoping to sell weapons in Port Nyanzaru had to go through Ekene-Afa or one of her weapon buyers, such as [[Silaha Mnunzi]].

She counted [[Alastar Bol]] of the [[Order of the Gauntlet]] as an ally.
document_data.History:
Ekene-Afa was originally a [[gladiator]] who fought for adulation and riches within Port Nyanzaru. After a few noted victories, she used her prize winnings to invest in a fledgling mercantile business that became wildly successful.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|48}} Even as she became a full-time trader and politician, Ekene-Afa remained a hero among the common folk who still recalled watching her in the arena. Her statue was included atop the [[Grand Coliseum]] alongside those of other great arena champions, and busts of her face decorated a number of street corners in the city.

After the rediscovery of the lost city of [[Omu]] during the events of the [[death curse]],{{ToA-time}} Ekene-Afa took an active role in directing adventurers to reclaim it.

When [[Idrianne Smoke]] and her [[fiend]]ish pirates laid siege to Port Nyanzaru, Ekene-Afa personally led the defense of the [[Port Nyanzaru/Market Ward|Market Ward]] as well as coordinated an attack against the pirate flagship, the ''[[Banshee (ship)|Banshee]]''.
